Suborn.definition: to induce or procure to commit an unlawful act and esp. perjury [an attempt to a witness] 2
Suborn.origin: [Latin subornare , from sub- secretly + ornare to prepare, equip]

1.definition: to induce or procure to commit an unlawful act and esp. perjury [an attempt to a witness]

2.definition: to induce (perjury) or obtain (perjured testimony) from a witness [an attorney and his client were jointly charged withperjury and perjury, respectively "W. R. LaFave and J. H. Israel"]
2.ing: perjury and perjury, respectively "W. R. LaFave and J. H. Israel"]
